Instance.description:
A picker interaction class that allows a user to view statistics and commodities and their current values on the target in a picker dialog.
Clicking on the stat would then bring up another dialog where the user can set a new value.

TunableVariant.name: stat_list
TunableVariant.description: List of stats we want to allow to be changed by this interaction. If nothing is set, it will just show all the stats on the object.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: List of stats we want to allow to be changed by this interaction. If nothing is set, it will just show all the stats on the object.

TunableTuple.name: stat_value_dialog
TunableTuple.description:
The dialog that is displayed (and asks for the user to enter a value to set for the statistic).
the selected stat's name is passed as a token as well as the stat's value is passed as an input override.

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background audio event string.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_bg_style
TunableEnum.description: The style background to apply to this dialog.

TunableList.name: dialog_options
TunableList.description: Options to apply to the dialog.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_style
TunableEnum.description: The style layout to apply to this dialog.

TunableVariant.name: icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify an icon to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

TunableVariant.name: icon_override_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows a different participant to be considered the owner of this dialog. Typically, this will only affect the Sim portrait used at the top of the dialog, but there could be other adverse affects so be sure to talk to your UI partner before tuning this.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be used as the owner of this dialog. If this participant doesn't exist, the default owner will be used instead.

Tunable.name: is_special_dialog
Tunable.description: If checked, UI will treat this as a special ok or ok/cancel dialog and represent the ok or ok/cancel options in a special way. They will use the text as a tooltip for ok or ok/cancel options and use particular icons for the buttons.

TunableEnum.name: phone_ring_type
TunableEnum.description: The phone ring type of this dialog. If tuned to anything other than None this dialog will only appear after clicking on the phone.

TunableVariant.name: secondary_icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify a secondary icon to be displayed. Only certain dialog types may support this field.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

TunableVariant.name: secondary_picker_icon_data
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify the texts to be displayed below the secondary_icon image in the dialog panel.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tuning for the title and description texts to accompany the secondary_icon image.

Tunable.name: description_text
Tunable.description: The dialog's title.

Tunable.name: title
Tunable.description: The dialog's title.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: The dialog's text.

TunableTuple.name: concatenation
TunableTuple.description: A list of localized string concatenations. These strings will be joined together into single line-separated string

TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: single
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableTuple.name: variation
TunableTuple.description: A list of possible localized string variations.

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: text_cancel
Tunable.description: The Cancel button text.

TunableTuple.name: stat_value
TunableTuple.description: Define a text input box to be show in the dialog. The player is able to enter text, and the dialog may perform certain validation checks before allowing the player to accept.

Tunable.name: check_profanity
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will check the input text for profanity.

TunableVariant.name: default_text
TunableVariant.description:
Default text that will show up when the text box is not in focus if the user hasn't entered anything in the text box yet.
If only default text is set, the text box will be blank when the user puts it in focus.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableVariant.name: initial_value
TunableVariant.description: The initial value of the text in the textbox. This is different from default text because the initial value stays regardless of if the text box is in focus.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: A localization string. This may either be a single string, a set to pick a random string from, or concatenation from list of string.

TunableTuple.name: concatenation
TunableTuple.description: A list of localized string concatenations. These strings will be joined together into single line-separated string

TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a LocalizedString tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: single
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableTuple.name: variation
TunableTuple.description: A list of possible localized string variations.

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableTuple.name: cas_first_name
TunableTuple.description: The minimum and maximum length of the text field are those enforced in CAS when assigning a first name to this Sim.

TunableTuple.name: cas_last_name
TunableTuple.description: The minimum and maximum length of the text field are those enforced in CAS when assigning a last name to this Sim.

TunableTuple.name: fixed
TunableTuple.description: The minimum and maximum length of the text field is specified by these tunables.

Tunable.name: max_length
Tunable.description: Max amount of characters the user can enter into the text box.

TunableVariant.name: min_length
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify the minimum length of input text the player has to enter before he/she can hit the 'OK' button.

Tunable.name: length
Tunable.description: Minimum amount of characters the user must enter in to the text box before he/she can click on the OK button.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows specification of a tooltip to display if the user has entered text length less than min_length.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableVariant.name: restricted_characters
TunableVariant.description: A string containing the character set regex to determine restricted characters in the text input.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableVariant.name: title
TunableVariant.description: Text that will be shown with the text input to describe what that user is inputing.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: text_ok
Tunable.description: The OK button text.

TunableVariant.name: text_tokens
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, define text tokens to be used to localized text.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Define the text tokens that are available to all text fields in the dialog, such as title, text, responses, default and initial text values, tooltips, etc.

TunableList.name: tokens
TunableList.description: A list of tokens that will be returned by this factory. Any string that uses this token will have token '0' be set to the first element, '1' to the second element, and so on. Do not let the list inheritance values confuse you; regardless of what the list element index is, the first element will always be 0, the second element 1, and so on.

TunableVariant.description: Define what the token at the specified index is.

TunableTuple.name: associated_club
TunableTuple.description: The token is a stored "associated_club" on this interaction. Only works with ClubMixerInteractions or ClubSuperInteractions.

TunableTuple.name: buck_amount
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number repesenting the amount of the specified buck type the specified participant has.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified statistic's value.

TunableTuple.name: career_data
TunableTuple.description: The token is a localized string, number, or Sim, representing the specified career data for the specified participant.

TunableVariant.name: career_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

Tunable.name: career_type
Tunable.description: The career we care about.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant's whose career data we care about.

TunableTuple.name: civic_policy
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the Civic Policy system.

TunableVariant.name: civic_policy_data
TunableVariant.description: The specific value to display.

TunableTuple.name: definition
TunableTuple.description: A catalog definition to use as a token. This is useful if you want to properly localize an object's name or description.

TunableTuple.name: game_component_data
TunableTuple.description: The token is a localized number or Sim representing the specified game component data from game component.

TunableVariant.name: game_component_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant's from whom the game component data we want to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: global_policy
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display data from the tuned global policy.

Tunable.name: global_policy
Tunable.description: The global policy from which data is displayed.

TunableEnum.name: token_property
TunableEnum.description: Which property from the Global Policy Token to use. NAME will use the policy's display name, PROGRESS will use the progress made over the max progress value.

TunableTuple.name: lifestyle_brand
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display the name of a Lifestyle Brand owned by a Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who owns the lifestyle brand.

TunableTuple.name: money_amount
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number representing the amount of Simoleons that were awarded in loot to the specified participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant for whom we fetch the earned amount of money.

TunableTuple.name: object_marketplace
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the object marketplace component and marketplace system.

TunableVariant.name: object_marketplace_data
TunableVariant.description: Please select what value you would like to use.

TunableTuple.name: object_property
TunableTuple.description: The token is a property of a game object. This could be catalog properties like its price or its rarity which is a property given by a component.

TunableEnum.name: obj_property
TunableEnum.description: The property of the object that we will request.

TunableTuple.name: participant_count
TunableTuple.description: The number of participants of the specified type.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: participant_type
TunableTuple.description: The token is a Sim or object participant from the interaction.

TunableVariant.name: formatter
TunableVariant.description: Define the format for this token.

TunableTuple.name: bullet_list
TunableTuple.description: The token is a string, which is a formatted bullet point list. Objects are grouped by definition. The text for each item must be specified.

Tunable.name: bullet_text
Tunable.description: The text for the bullet entry. The string is provided the following tokens, in this order: 0 An object representitive of the group 1 The number of objects in the group

TunableTuple.name: single
TunableTuple.description: The token is a single object name. If multiple participants are returned, an arbitrary one is used. That is, unless the mismatch key is specified. In that case, the string is used unless all of the participants' definitions match.

TunableVariant.name: mismatch_name
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the object name to use when using a multi- object participant yielding definitions with different names.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: picked_part
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display the name of a picked part.

TunableTuple.name: scholarship_letter_component_data
TunableTuple.description: The token can be used to get strings representing scholarship information from the scholarship letter component of an object.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom to get the scholarship letter component data.

TunableVariant.name: scholarship_letter_component_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: sickness
TunableTuple.description: The token is the name of the sickness on the specified Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who is sick.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_value
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number representing the value of a specific statistic from the selected participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified statistic's value.

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: The statistic's whose value we want to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: street
TunableTuple.description: Using the Street Selector tuning, provide a token localization appropriate street selection.

TunableVariant.name: street
TunableVariant.description: Select what street to test.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: Identify a specific Street.

TunableTuple.name: via_street_participant
TunableTuple.description: Get the street participant.

TunableVariant.name: via_zone_source
TunableVariant.description: Select the street to use by specifying a Zone Source.

TunableTuple.name: use_current_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get the active zone.

TunableTuple.name: use_participant_home_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get a participant's home zone. Can be None if they don't have one.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Test against the participant's home zone. Townies' home zone will be None.

TunableTuple.name: use_pick_info
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone of the lot the user clicked on.

TunableTuple.name: use_picked_zone_ids
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone from the interaction's picked_zone_ids participant. Usually comes from a picker.

TunableVariant.name: street_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableVariant.name: timeout_duration
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, override the timeout duration for this dialog in game time.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The time, in sim minutes, that this dialog should time out.

TunableVariant.name: title
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this dialog will include title text.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The dialog's title.

TunableList.name: ui_responses
TunableList.description: A list of buttons that are mapped to UI commands.

TunableTuple.description: A dialog response.

TunableVariant.name: response_command
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specifies a command to be called by the client.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A UI Response that sends a server command.

TunableList.name: arguments
TunableList.description: The arguments for this command. Arguments will be added after the command.

TunableVariant.description: An argument being passed to the command.

TunableTuple.name: boolean
TunableTuple.description: A boolean value.

TunableTuple.name: floating_point
TunableTuple.description: A floating point number.

TunableTuple.name: integer
TunableTuple.description: An integer number.

TunableTuple.name: participant_id
TunableTuple.description: UI Response argument that will resolve the participant specified.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant to resolve for this response argument. The value sent will be the id of the specified participant. If more than one participant is found, it will only send the id of the first participant found.

TunableTuple.name: special_command_data
TunableTuple.description: This will use the data passed into the show_dialog() function. This must be supported with GPE work, so only use this if you have talked to a GPE.

TunableTuple.name: string
TunableTuple.description: A string.

Tunable.name: command
Tunable.description: The command.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: text
Tunable.description: The prompt's text.

TunableEnum.name: ui_request
TunableEnum.description: This prompt's associated UI action.

Tunable.name: stat_value_text
Tunable.description: the string that will show the current value in the picker and within the input override. Should include {0.Number}.
